required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a New Antidiabetic Food Concept Based on Modulation of the Gut Microbiota

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the project is to study the connection between bacterial fermentation in the colon of prebiotic substrates and effects on systemic metabolism and appetite i healthy humans

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose with this project is to study the association between bacterial fermentation in the colon of specific mixtures of cereal dietary fiber and effects on systemic metabolism and appetite regulation. For this purpose, short term studies are performed in healthy adult subjects. Different cereals, cereal blends and from cereal extracted dietary fiber will be studied, as well as effects of different processing of the cereals. Cardiometabolic test markers and colonic fermentation metabolites will be followed up to 14 h after intake of the test substrates, and gut microbiota composition will be determined prior to and after the interventions.

primary_outcome.description: Postprandial blood glucose regulation (incremental area under the curve) acute after intake of the test products and at forthcoming meals within 14 h after consumption of test products.

secondary_outcome.description: Postprandial serum insulin concentrations (incremental area under the curve) acute after intake of the test products and at forthcoming meals within 14 h after consumption of test products.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: first stool delivered from14 h after intake
secondary_outcome.description: effects on gut microbiota composition after intake of prebiotics

secondary_outcome.measure: plasma GLP-1 (glucagon-like peptide-1 ), PYY (peptide tyrosine tyrosine), Ghrelin
secondary_outcome.description: Gastro-intestinale hormones involved in appetite and metabolic regulation

secondary_outcome.measure: plasma: CRP (C reactive protein ), IL (interleukin)-6, IL-18, IL-8, IL-1, IL-10, LBP (lipopolysaccharide-binding protein), (PAI-1plasminogen activator inhibitor)

secondary_outcome.description: gut hormone involved in gut mucosa integrity
cholesterol and free fatty acids in plasma
signal protein important for brain functions, but also involved in metabolic regulation
a neuro peptide peptides involved in appetite and metabolic regulation
a neuro peptide that participates in the regulation of hunger and fat storage.

other_outcome.description: determined with VAS (visual analogue scale) scales (0-100 mm)

other_outcome.time_frame: 4 h after intake of a test product or the control product
other_outcome.description: ad libitum intake at a second meal after intake of test products

arm_group.description: Cereal based muesli made from typical Swedish cereals. All experimental products have different types and amounts of dietary fibre (df).
Cereal based muesli made from typical Swedish cereals. All experimental products have different types and amounts of df.
Cereal based muesli made from typical Swedish cereals. All experimental products have different types and amounts of df.
Cereal based muesli made from typical Swedish cereals. All experimental products have different types and amounts of df.
Cereal based muesli made from typical Swedish cereals. All experimental products have different types and amounts of df.
A cereal based product with low concentrations of df.

intervention.description: Cereal products based on rye, barley, wheat, oat, and corn

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy adults
- BMI<30
- non smokers
- consuming a non-vegetarian diet that follows the Nordic guidances
Exclusion Criteria:
- fasting blood glucose >6.1 mmol/L
- known cardio-metabolic disease (e.g. diabetes, hypertension, metabolic syndrome), gastro-intestinal disorders such as IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) that can interfere with the study results, food allergies. Further no antibiotics or probiotics should have been consumed within 4 weeks prior to and during the study.

facility.name: Food Technology, engineering and Nutrition, LTH, Lund University
